alpha.reasoning: Adjust based on sample size, more conservative (lower) values for larger samples. If < 500, use 0.1; Else if 500-10000 (<10000 but >500), use 0.05; Else if > 10000, using 0.01.

indep_test.reasoning: Choose based on data type: 'fisherz' for linear continuous; 'chisq' for discrete; 'gsq' for simplied mixed data types; 'kci' for general nonlinear data; 'fastkci' is a fast version of kci for nonlinear data; 'rcit' is a fast version of kci approximation for nonlinear data. Note [IMPORTANT]: Some nonlinear tests are extremely slow. Only consider 'kci' and 'fastkci' only if when the variable size is less than 10, consider 'rcit' only if the variable size is less than 15.
